title: Curriculum Design for Teachers' Mathematical Knowledge for Teaching Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary mathematical concepts and curriculum material analysis
context.additional_context: Real-time video lectures conducted in a smartphone-based limited technological environment, with a focus on strengthening mathematical knowledge application through curriculum material analysis.

learning_goals: Identify and analyze mathematical ideas, representations, and connections in curriculum materials
Critically review curriculum materials by applying criteria for evaluating mathematical problem complexity

By the end of the one-week course, learners design a three-tiered learning path (beginner/intermediate/advanced) based on math diagnostic assessment results—covering two foundational concepts, three applied problems, and one project task—and receive feedback averaging 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) from two out of three peer evaluators.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
